intro: Strobilanthes maclellandii var. latipes, commonly known as the golden flame bush, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in dense clusters during the rainy season. The plant belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is known for its ornamental value in horticulture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with well-drained soil and partial to full sun exposure. Its unique floral display makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking vibrant, seasonal color.
